team_metadata.purpose: Comprehensive audit of build system documentation consistency (dx.sh, pom.xml, reactor.json, DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md, Mermaid diagrams) against 15 new Diátaxis documents

quantum_1.name: Reactor Order & Dependency Graph Quantum
quantum_1.quantum_focus: Maven reactor sequencing, module dependencies, topological correctness
responsibilities: Parse root pom.xml <modules> section and extract module list
Extract all <dependency> declarations from yawl-parent and child POMs (focus: inter-module deps)
Compare pom.xml module order vs reactor.json FM7 ordering
Verify topological sort: dependencies always precede dependents
Check DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md §3.1 G_compile layer definitions (Layer 0-6)
Verify dx-workflow.md build order recommendations match reactor.json
Check for missing modules or cyclical dependencies
success_criteria: pom.xml module count matches reactor.json (both = 19 modules)
Module order in pom.xml matches topological sort of reactor.json
All inter-module dependencies in child POMs are satisfied before module position in order
No cycles detected in dependency graph
DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md layer definitions (Layer 0-6) align with reactor.json layers
dx-workflow.md 'Build Order' section matches reactor.json positions

All 19 modules accounted for: {yawl-utilities, yawl-elements, yawl-authentication, yawl-engine, yawl-stateless, yawl-resourcing, yawl-scheduling, yawl-security, yawl-integration, yawl-monitoring, yawl-webapps, yawl-control-panel, yawl-mcp-a2a-app, yawl-worklet, yawl-pi, yawl-graalpy, yawl-graaljs, yawl-graalwasm, yawl-ggen}

expected_findings.pass_scenario: Reactor order is canonical; all dependencies satisfy topological sort; 19 modules verified; no cycles
potential_issues: pom.xml module order differs from reactor.json (would indicate inconsistent source of truth)
Missing module in pom.xml or reactor.json
Layer assignments in DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md don't match reactor.json (confusing parallelization)
Cyclical dependency or out-of-order module (blocks parallel builds)

quantum_1.integration_point_1: Reports reactor order canonical form to Quantum 3 (ParallelGroups) for comparison with dx.sh parallelism
quantum_1.integration_point_2: Reports module dependencies to Quantum 4 (BuildProfilesAndGates) for gate sequence validation

quantum_2.name: CLI Flags & Environment Variables Quantum
quantum_2.quantum_focus: dx.sh command-line interface, argument parsing, environment variable handling
responsibilities: Parse dx.sh script entirely (all invocations and branching logic)
Extract all supported command formats and flags
Extract all environment variables (DX_*, JAVA_HOME, etc.) and document their effect
Cross-reference dx.sh behavior against dx-workflow.md CLI documentation
Verify environment variable descriptions match actual script behavior
Check dx.sh sets correct JAVA_HOME for Java 25 (lines 38-47)
Verify all flags/modes documented in REFERENCE docs match actual implementation
success_criteria: All dx.sh command formats documented in dx-workflow.md (compile, test, all, -pl, compile all, test all)
All environment variables (DX_OFFLINE, DX_FAIL_AT, DX_VERBOSE, DX_CLEAN) documented with correct defaults
Java 25 enforcement block matches documentation (Java 25 required, auto-detect JAVA_HOME)
Offline/online mode behavior matches documented defaults (auto-detect)
Fail-fast behavior matches documented fast-loop philosophy
Module targeting (-pl) behavior matches documentation examples
dx.sh exit codes documented and consistent with behavior

expected_findings.pass_scenario: dx.sh command formats, flags, env vars all documented; Java 25 requirement enforced correctly
potential_issues: dx.sh supports flags not documented in dx-workflow.md (e.g., undocumented -vv flag)
Environment variable defaults in dx.sh differ from documentation
Java version check fails on some systems or doesn't enforce Java 25
Offline mode behavior not documented or inconsistent
Exit codes not documented but used in automation

quantum_2.integration_point_1: Reports CLI argument contracts to Quantum 3 (parallelism) for validation of -pl flag behavior
quantum_2.integration_point_2: Reports environment variable effects to Quantum 5 (DoD gates) for error handling documentation

quantum_3.name: Parallel Build Groups & Critical Path Quantum
quantum_3.quantum_focus: Parallel execution, critical path, -T 1.5C flag correctness, layer-based parallelism
responsibilities: Verify -T 1.5C flag definition and behavior in dx.sh and DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md
Extract all parallelization directives from reactor.json (layer definitions)
Validate critical path analysis: which module sequence determines total build time?
Cross-reference DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md parallelization groups vs reactor.json layers
Check for documented build time targets (<90s clean build per G_compile)
Verify that parallel groups don't violate dependency constraints
Analyze how dx.sh --all parallelizes vs incremental builds
success_criteria: 1.5x CPU parallelism flag clearly explained (-T 1.5C) in both dx.sh and documentation
Reactor layer definitions (Layer 0-6) enable valid parallel compilation
All modules in same layer have zero inter-dependencies
Critical path identified and documented: longest dependency chain determines build time
Build time targets documented (<90s clean build) and feasible given parallelization
Incremental vs full build parallelism strategy explained
No dependency violations when layers compile in parallel

expected_findings.pass_scenario: Layer parallelism is valid; 1.5C parallelism clearly documented; <90s target feasible
potential_issues: Modules in same layer have undeclared dependencies (blocks parallel execution)
Parallelism flag not enforced or documented incorrectly
Critical path not identified; build time target unrealistic
Documentation claims parallelism but pom.xml has cycles

quantum_3.integration_point_1: Receives reactor order from Quantum 1; verifies layers respect dependencies
quantum_3.integration_point_2: Cross-validates with Quantum 5 (DoD gates) on test parallelization and time constraints

quantum_4.name: Build Profiles & Quality Gates Quantum
quantum_4.quantum_focus: Maven profiles (java25, agent-dx, ci, analysis, security, prod), quality gate definitions, enforcement
responsibilities: Extract all profile definitions from root pom.xml (if present) or child POMs
Map profiles mentioned in dx-workflow.md to actual pom.xml implementations
Verify DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md gate taxonomy (G_compile, G_test, G_guard, G_analysis, G_security, G_documentation, G_release) against actual Maven commands
Validate that each gate predicate is measurable and executable
Cross-reference 'analysis' profile (JaCoCo + SpotBugs) with gate definitions
Verify 'security' profile implementation (SBOM, OWASP dependency check, TLS enforcement)
Check that profile selection doesn't override dependency versions (centralized in parent POM)
success_criteria: All 6 profiles documented in dx-workflow.md exist in pom.xml: java25, agent-dx, ci, analysis, security, prod
G_compile gate: mvn -T 1.5C clean compile exits 0 (no compiler warnings as errors)
G_test gate: mvn -T 1.5C clean test exits 0, 100% pass
G_guard gate: 14 anti-patterns absent (mapped to hyper-validate.sh or equivalent)
G_analysis gate: SpotBugs, PMD, Checkstyle zero violations via 'analysis' profile
G_security gate: SBOM clean, no critical CVEs, TLS 1.3 enforced via 'security' profile
G_documentation gate: all new packages have package-info.java
G_release gate: all above + integration tests + performance baseline
Profile selection doesn't override centralized version properties
key_files_to_verify: /home/user/yawl/docs/v6/DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md (§2.1 Gate Summary Table and §3 Gate Specifications)

expected_findings.pass_scenario: All 7 gates are defined, measurable, and enforceable; profiles match documentation
potential_issues: Profiles exist but gate definitions are vague or unmeasurable
G_guard gate doesn't map to actual hook implementation
Security profile doesn't enforce TLS 1.3 or OWASP checks
Analysis profile missing PMD or Checkstyle
Version properties can be overridden by profile selections (violates centralization)

quantum_4.integration_point_1: Receives module dependencies from Quantum 1; validates gates respect build order
quantum_4.integration_point_2: Receives parallelism constraints from Quantum 3; validates gate execution within time budgets

quantum_5.name: Definition of Done & Enforcement Hooks Quantum
quantum_5.quantum_focus: DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md completeness, hook integration, acceptance criteria enforcement
responsibilities: Verify all 7 gates (G_compile through G_release) have measurable predicates in DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md
Cross-reference DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md gate definitions with actual automation (hooks, Maven commands)
Validate H-set (TODO, FIXME, mock, stub, fake, empty_return, silent_fallback, lie) implementation
Verify hyper-validate.sh hook implementation covers all 14 anti-patterns mentioned in DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md §1.2
Check Q-invariant (real_impl OR throw UnsupportedOperationException) is documented and enforceable
Validate package-info.java requirement for G_documentation gate
Cross-reference DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md with HYPER_STANDARDS docs for consistency
success_criteria: All 7 gates have clear, measurable predicates: compile, test, guard, analysis, security, documentation, release
Gate ordering matches DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md partial order: G_compile < G_test < ... < G_release
H-set (8 items) properly defined and mapped to hyper-validate.sh checks
Q-invariant documented: every public method performs real work or throws UnsupportedOperationException
Gate commands are actual, executable Maven/bash commands (not aspirational)
Package-info.java requirement is documented and enforceable
G_release gate includes integration tests and performance baseline
hyper-validate.sh hook is integrated into pre-commit or pre-push workflow
key_files_to_verify: Mermaid diagrams (if present) showing gate flow and enforcement

expected_findings.pass_scenario: All 7 gates documented, measurable, enforceable; H-set and Q-invariant integrated into hooks
potential_issues: DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md defines gates vaguely (e.g., 'pass comprehensive tests')
hyper-validate.sh missing some anti-patterns or doesn't block on violation
G_release gate references 'integration tests' but none are automated
Package-info.java requirement not enforceable in CI/CD
Gate ordering doesn't match partial order in documentation
Q-invariant not validated; allows mock/stub/fake implementations

quantum_5.integration_point_1: Receives gate execution timings from Quantum 3 (parallelism); validates gates execute within budget
quantum_5.integration_point_2: Integrates findings from Quantum 4 (profiles); validates gate commands match profile selections

integration_point_A.name: Reactor Order Canonical Form
integration_point_A.verification: Reactor module order in pom.xml matches reactor.json, which determines correct topological sort and enables valid parallelism in layers
integration_point_A.expected_alignment: All three quantums report same module ordering and layer assignments
integration_point_A.failure_resolution: If pom.xml order differs from reactor.json, reactor.json is canonical (FM7 poka-yoke). Update pom.xml.

integration_point_B.name: Gate Execution Commands & Timing
integration_point_B.verification: Each gate command (G_compile: mvn clean compile, G_test: mvn clean test, etc.) uses correct profile and parallelism (-T 1.5C)
integration_point_B.expected_alignment: DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md gate commands match actual pom.xml profile selection and -T 1.5C parallelism
integration_point_B.failure_resolution: If gates don't use -T 1.5C or wrong profile, update DEFINITION-OF-DONE.md gate specifications.

integration_point_C.name: CLI Argument Contracts & Parallelism
integration_point_C.verification: dx.sh -pl argument correctly invokes 'mvn -pl modules -amd clean compile' respecting reactor order and parallelism
integration_point_C.expected_alignment: dx.sh -pl behavior documented in dx-workflow.md matches actual implementation and respects topological sort
integration_point_C.failure_resolution: If dx.sh -pl doesn't respect reactor order, fix dx.sh or document limitation in dx-workflow.md.

consolidation_strategy.synthesis_approach: Lead (you) run single final consolidation phase after all 5 engineers report GREEN

consolidation_steps.action: Collect individual verification reports from all 5 engineers (expected: ~50 findings each)
consolidation_steps.output: 5 verification reports with findings, pass/fail status, and evidence

consolidation_steps.action: Cross-check integration points A-C: are quantums aligned on reactor order, gate execution, CLI contracts?
consolidation_steps.output: Integration point consensus (GREEN if all aligned, RED if conflicts detected)

consolidation_steps.action: Synthesize findings into unified verification summary document
consolidation_steps.output: COMPREHENSIVE_VERIFICATION_REPORT.md with: per-quantum status, integration point alignment, consolidated findings

consolidation_steps.action: List all inconsistencies found (if any) with remediation priority
consolidation_steps.output: Inconsistency manifest: which file(s) need fixing and why

consolidation_steps.action: Run dx.sh all locally to validate build passes end-to-end
consolidation_steps.output: Build verification: dx.sh all exits 0, all modules compile + test green

consolidation_steps.action: If all GREEN: commit verification report with evidence
consolidation_steps.output: Single commit with verification artifacts and evidence chain

verification_report_schema.title: YAWL Build System Comprehensive Verification Report

sections.content: Overall status (GREEN|YELLOW|RED), count of findings per quantum, critical path blockers
5 subsections, one per engineer, with: checklist status, key findings, confidence level
3 subsections (A, B, C), showing consensus or conflicts between quantums
Prioritized list of conflicts found (if any): file, line, expected vs actual, fix priority
Markdown code blocks showing file excerpts and verification results

success_criteria: All 5 engineers report GREEN on their checklists
Integration points A, B, C show consensus (no conflicts)
Inconsistency manifest is empty (or contains only YELLOW items requiring clarification)
dx.sh all exits 0 with all modules compiling and testing green
Verification report is commit-ready with evidence trail

team_formation_checklist: { id: 1, item: 'Run team-recommendation.sh hook (confirm team is viable)', status: 'pending' }
{ id: 2, item: 'Verify all 5 quantums are truly orthogonal (no file conflicts)', status: 'pending' }
{ id: 3, item: 'Confirm each engineer task is 20-40 minutes scope', status: 'pending' }
{ id: 4, item: 'Update facts via: bash scripts/observatory/observatory.sh', status: 'pending' }
{ id: 5, item: 'Enable team feature: CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1', status: 'pending' }
{ id: 6, item: 'Ensure lead has local dx.sh all passing before team spawns', status: 'pending' }
{ id: 7, item: 'Distribute quantum definitions and expected findings to each engineer', status: 'pending' }

team_communication_protocol.message_frequency: Each engineer sends status update after each major finding (every 5-10 minutes)
team_communication_protocol.critical_messages: If finding conflicts with another quantum's assumption, message lead immediately
team_communication_protocol.consolidation_messaging: Engineers submit final report (checklist + findings + confidence) before lead synthesis phase
team_communication_protocol.escalation: If engineer finds blocker (e.g., missing pom.xml profile), message lead within 5 minutes
